top_categories.workout_context: Vermont Overland's Vermont pavé (7 sectors rough roads), Technical climbs forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 54 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Vermont Overland's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
At Vermont Overland, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
130ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Vermont Overland, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
7,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
7,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Vermont Overland. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
54 miles on Vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Smooth pedaling at 54 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Low-cadence force work for 7,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Vermont Overland’s 54 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Vermont Overland demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: vermont pavé (7 sectors rough roads), technical climbs, gravel and dirt roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 54 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Over Under to prepare you for 54 miles of vermont pavé—7 sectors rough unmaintained roads in Woodstock, Vermont.
